page.title: 05Holiday Attractions.
page.content: Today the holiday attractions and accomodation are largely confined to the area around the pier and the cliff areas above. A survey carried out in the summer of 1985 showed a swimming pool, the Floral Hall for live entertainment, several amusement arcades and a range of small restaurants, snack bars and a public house. There was also a putting green on Pop's Meadow where years ago a concert party performed nightly. Some twenty hotels and guest houses provided accomodation with a number of holiday flats. The pier and north beach were however still very crowded on fine days between May and September with mostly family groups coming from mainly the Midlands and South-East England, staying however for the most part in caravans and holiday camps outside Gorleston.
